AvD.synopsis: Upon our learning of Stelmane’s murder, we stumble on the Emperor in a dream, reflecting nostalgically on its past life with Stelmane and all that it hopes to reclaim (all part of the mind flayer manipulation).
AvD.how_to_trigger: Go to Act 3 (BGO)Queue Campnight NIGHT_DaisyStelmaneEnd the Day and Go to Bed

AvD_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player wakes up in the dream field. Shot of the Emperor is sitting with its back to you on a bench, alone, looking unusually pensive and morose against the backdrop of the astral plane - the globe of domination visible in the distance. All is quiet now in contrast to the battles we previously saw here. The player approaches.

AvD_96.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_96.text: How did you - oh. It's you. I must have let my mind wander. Enough for you to wander in.
AvD_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player wakes up in the dream field. Shot of the Emperor is sitting with its back to you on a bench, alone, looking unusually pensive and morose against the backdrop of the astral plane - the globe of domination visible in the distance. All is quiet now in contrast to the battles we previously saw here. The player approaches. The Emperor notices us with a start - they weren't expecting us.NodeContext: Emperor startled by player, looks behind to his right, before looking back infront

AvD_72.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_72.text: Forgive me. I am drained. Ever since you killed Ketheric and took his Netherstone, the Chosen's control of the brain has been... brittle.

AvD_58.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_58.text: Its rebellion against Orin and Gortash has been fierce. Even as it executes their final orders.

AvD_34.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_34.text: Once those orders are complete, there is a good chance it will break free.

AvD_28.speaker: Narrator
AvD_28.text: *You feel the Emperor's fear as if it were your own. An elder brain enslaved is one thing, an elder brain unleashed will be the end of everything.*

AvD_61.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_61.text: Beautiful, isn't it? The mighty Prince Orpheus, contained in submissive slumber.
AvD_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer shot of globe of domination and skull vista. NodeContext: Emperor looking in front

AvD_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor sat on bench. Player stood next to him. Shot from behind of the two them looking out at the view together.

AvD_53.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_53.text: Come, you may as well sit a while, now that you're here.
AvD_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor pats the spot on the bench next to him. Player sits beside Emperor. NodeContext: Emperor looks to his right at player

AvD_15.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Awkward silence before the Emperor speaks.

AvD_12.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_12.text: Trying to guard us. The brain is restless. But I'm distracted, and my lack of focus is endangering us.

AvD_55.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_55.text: An accurate summary. I have found myself distracted of late.

AvD_64.speaker: Player
AvD_64.text: I expected you to be more on guard this close to the brain.

AvD_106.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_106.text: You are correct. I should be.

AvD_4.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_4.text: We are more alike than you would like to acknowledge. I am merely further along in my evolution than you.

AvD_5.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_5.text: I understand my outer membrane and appendages unnerve you. But despite my exterior, I still feel.

AvD_97.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_97.text: I'm haunted by memories. They are relentless. I can think of nothing - no one - else.

AvD_11.speaker: Player
AvD_11.text: Belynne, is it? The duke that's dead?

AvD_82.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_82.text: The very same. Duke Stelmane, as she was known in Baldur's Gate.

AvD_109.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_109.text: Duke Stelmane. Or Belynne, as I knew her. I wasn't ready for her death.

AvD_87.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_87.text: Indeed. Duke Stelmane. Or as I knew her - Belynne. When she was alive.

AvD_85.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_85.text: Not love, no. What I had with Belynne Stelmane was much more than that. It was - unique.

AvD_86.speaker: Player
AvD_86.text: The past is past. Move on.

AvD_0.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_0.text: You are impatient. Even in this, you remind me of her, of Belynne Stelmane.

AvD_67.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_67.text: At least - when she was alive.

AvD_70.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_70.text: You thought you were my first ally?
AvD_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacts with surprise at the longing in the Emperor's voice when it talks of Stelmane. Emperor clocks our surprise.

AvD_39.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_39.text: Far from it. I have long sought the allyship of others - it is the only way to succeed.

AvD_94.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_94.text: Though my relationship with Belynne was - different, from my relationship with you.

AvD_88.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_88.text: In a way. But not the way you're thinking of.

AvD_74.speaker: Player
AvD_74.text: Did you manipulate her like you manipulated me?

AvD_65.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_65.text: I see you are unable to let that go. But do not forget that I trusted you with my life, as you trusted me with yours.

AvD_84.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_84.text: Manipulation or not, we need each other. My relationship with Belynne was similar in this regard. Though - less dramatic.

AvD_35.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_35.text: In life, she was my business partner. Back when we ran the Knights of the Shield. A difficult task, for a mind flayer.

AvD_104.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_104.text: Duke Stelmane trusted me, and the city trusted her. I conceived the plot, but Belynne took centre-stage.

AvD_66.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_66.text: It was she who met with the merchants, politicians, patriars. It was she who negotiated deals and signed off on agreements. Her rooms played host to the most important conversations in the city.

AvD_103.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_103.text: Together, we brought order to chaos. At its height, everything that happened in that city went through the Shield. Through us.

AvD_27.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_27.text: I could not have done any of it without her. Just as I cannot do any of this without you. But now she's gone.
AvD_27.context: NodeContext: voice slightly breaking, as if on the verge of tears

AvD_17.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_17.text: I appreciate the offer, but I don't think it will help.

AvD_81.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_81.text: What I feel is deeper than superficial cures can reach. And not entirely unwelcome.

AvD_23.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_23.text: Most people think that mind flayers are soulless husks who feel nothing. I am glad you are not most people.

AvD_8.speaker: Player
AvD_8.text: Give the Emperor's hand a reassuring squeeze.

AvD_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player gives the Emperor's hand a squeeze with a look of ecnouragement. The mind flayer gives a look of gratitude.

AvD_2.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_2.text: You have shown me great empathy. We are closer now, close enough - I hope - that I can ask you to reconsider your position regarding your physical form.
AvD_2.context: NodeContext: Player is on Emperor's right

AvD_51.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_51.text: I know it is no easy choice for you, but we will have a far better time ridding the city of Gortash if you accept just a touch of illithidness.

AvD_68.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_68.text: Not to mention the elder brain itself. Our chances against it greatly improve the more illithid we both are.

AvD_44.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_44.text: Another quake. The brain is rebelling again. I need to focus. And so do you.
AvD_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

AvD_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The emperor gives a sage, knowing nod.

AvD_26.speaker: Player
AvD_26.text: If I didn't know you were a mind flayer, I'd say you were upset.

AvD_29.speaker: Player
AvD_29.text: Drop the act. I know you don't have feelings.

AvD_71.speaker: Player
AvD_71.text: Watching your loves die only makes you tougher.

AvD_47.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_47.text: You are weaker than I imagined, if you lie to yourself so.

AvD_107.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_107.text: You think that mind flayers are soulless husks who feel nothing. Belynne thought the same at first.
AvD_107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives mind flayer a skeptical look.

AvD_105.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_105.text: You are wrong. Feeling is vital to the pursuit of anyone's goals. Even a mind flayer's.

AvD_49.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_49.text: Like you, mind flayers know fear. Like you, we crave recognition.

AvD_19.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_19.text: But unlike you, unlike the others of my kind, I am no slave to either.

AvD_25.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_25.text: My end is and has always been freedom.

AvD_37.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_37.text: Belynne understood this. Belynne became my freedom.

AvD_33.speaker: Player
AvD_33.text: Don't let your guard down again.

AvD_69.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_69.text: But I could do with your assistance. You remain attached to your physical form. I suggest you shed that attachment.

AvD_38.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_38.text: We will do better against the elder brain the more illithid we both are.

AvD_93.speaker: Player
AvD_93.text: I know you're trying to manipulate me. It's not working. I know what you are.

AvD_62.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_62.text: You would do well to be more like me. Your humanoid tendencies are becoming an encumbrance. Leave me.

AvD_32.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_32.text: You would do well to be more like me. Now leave.

AvD_102.speaker: Player
AvD_102.text: Sorry I was mean to you.

AvD_100.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_100.text: Another quake. The brain is rebelling again. I need to focus.
AvD_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

AvD_41.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_41.text: I am glad you were able to learn something.

AvD_22.speaker: Player
AvD_22.text: I really don't care what your relationship with her was like.

AvD_6.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_6.text: And yet you emulate it so well.

AvD_30.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_30.text: Very well. Then let us move on.

AvD_3.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_3.text: You remain very attached to your physical form. I suggest you shed it.

AvD_52.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_52.text: I need to focus. The brain is rebelling again. Be on your way and leave me to my thoughts.

AvD_48.speaker: Player
AvD_48.text: I just want a dreamless sleep for once.

AvD_110.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_110.text: I apologise. I didn't mean to burden you with my woes. You have enough to worry about.

AvD_99.speaker: Narrator
AvD_99.text: *As your eyes blink shut, you fall into the deepest slumber of your life. A quietness so vast it feels almost like death.*
AvD_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player's eyes fall shut. Fade to black.

AvD_111.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_111.text: It's rebelling against Orin and Gortash. Fiercely.

AvD_80.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_80.text: I suspected that when we took Ketheric's stone, the brain would begin to break free. Those brainquakes confirm that my suspicion was correct.

AvD_83.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
AvD_83.text: I do not know what happens now when it receives their orders, and I do not dare guess.
